metadata.Description: The International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA) is an intergovernmental organization that supports countries in their transition to a sustainable energy future. It promotes the widespread adoption and sustainable use of all forms of renewable energy, including bioenergy, geothermal, hydropower, ocean, solar, and wind energy.

International Renewable Energy Agency (I.Description: IRENA promotes the adoption of renewable energy globally through advocacy, sharing best practices, and by providing actionable data and information.
IRENA provides policy advisory services to governments to craft regulations and frameworks that facilitate renewable energy integration.
IRENA supports technology and innovation in the renewable energy sector by facilitating research, sharing innovative practices, and fostering international partnerships.
IRENA conducts capacity building programs aimed at enhancing the skills and knowledge of stakeholders in the renewable energy field.
IRENA facilitates investment and finance in renewable energy by connecting projects with potential investors and offering guidance on creating conducive investment environments.
IRENA leads international collaboration efforts, bringing together governments, private sector, and other stakeholders to accelerate the global transition to renewable energy.
IRENA collaborates with the Sustainable Energy Hub to align global efforts towards accelerating the adoption of renewable energy and promoting sustainable practices across sectors.
